subject: Re: [junit] Git problems
msgSnippet: Finally got it done.  Sorry to James--I had to make sure I could do the whole process myself.  Thanks to James, I had a fighting chance (although it took a
messageBody:
Finally got it done. Sorry to James--I had to make sure I could do the
whole process myself. Thanks to James, I had a fighting chance (although it
took a while to realize that git cvsimport could only work with the
anonymous cvs repo access, not ssh cvs access).

Please let me know if anything is missing:

http://github.com/KentBeck/junit

David Saff

On Fri, Jan 30, 2009 at 11:23 AM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

> I'm going to give this a try. Thanks!
>
> David
>
>
> On Wed, Jan 28, 2009 at 5:55 AM, James Abley <james.abley@...>wrote:
>
>> 2009/1/28 David Saff <david@...>:
>> > James,
>> >
>> > Sorry for the long response. I apparently only responded psychically.
>> Kent
>> > already has a repo at
>> >
>> > http://github.com/KentBeck/junit
>> >
>> > Any chance you can merge your repo into that one, and request Kent to
>> > accept? Thanks,
>> >
>> > David
>>
>> Hi David,
>>
>> Looking at Kent's repository, there doesn't appear to be much in it
>> (just the README and a single Wiki page?). I think the easiest way may
>> be to delete the existing repository, clone my repository and push it
>> all up into his repository as described in this guide [1].
>>
>> Let me know if that won't work and I'll see if I can suggest another
>> option.
>>
>> Cheers,
>>
>> James
>>
>> [1] http://github.com/guides/how-to-move-a-repo-to-another-account
>>
>> >
>> > On Fri, Jan 16, 2009 at 6:28 PM, James Abley <james.abley@...>
>> wrote:
>> >
>> >> 2009/1/16 kentb <kentb@...>:
>> >> > I haven't seen it. It looks very powerful but I'm looking for simple
>> and
>> >> > fool proof. I'd like a web page somewhere with one input field for
>> the
>> >> CVS
>> >> > repository and one input field for the Github project and a button
>> >> labelled
>> >> > "Poof!".
>> >> >
>> >> > Cheers,
>> >> >
>> >> > Kent Beck
>> >> > Three Rivers Institute
>> >> >
>> >>
>> >> That would be nice! But I seem to have successfully imported all of
>> >> CVS locally. Sourceforge access was faster than I gave it credit for.
>> >>
>> >> First off, I checked out /cvsroot/junit junit locally.
>> >> # go into the working copy
>> >> $ cd junit
>> >> # clone the CVS repos into local git repos
>> >> $ git cvsimport -v -C ../junit.git
>> >> # Check that the result looks fine
>> >> $ cd ../junit.git
>> >> $ git branch
>> >> Version4
>> >> Version431
>> >> * master
>> >> origin
>> >> saff_r41_runner_refactoring
>> >> vendor
>> >> $ git log | head
>> >> commit 34dd9f4e2bebbcf694dcb855a29edff9243a10d3
>> >> Author: kbeck <kbeck>
>> >> Date: Tue Jan 6 04:02:00 2009 +0000
>> >>
>> >> Fixed 2191102 and 2196462.
>> >>
>> >> commit 90bf3119a6326671cc467386036302cc6040f752
>> >> Author: kbeck <kbeck>
>> >> Date: Sat Dec 20 15:36:48 2008 +0000
>> >>
>> >> I'm running Ubuntu 8.10 with default packages for git-* and cvsps.
>> >>
>> >> I then created a new empty repository on github via the GUI and pushed
>> >> it all up from my local repository.
>> >>
>> >> $ git remote add origin git@...:jabley/junit.git
>> >> $ git push -v origin --all
>> >>
>> >> http://github.com/jabley/junit/tree/master
>> >>
>> >> I think that's what you're after?
>> >>
>> >> If you like, I'll take a look at transferring ownership of that
>> >> repository on github?
>> >>
>> >> Cheers,
>> >>
>> >> James
>> >>
>> >> ------------------------------------
>> >>
>> >> Yahoo! Groups Links
>> >>
>> >>
>> >>
>> >>
>> >
>> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>> >
>> >
>>
>> ------------------------------------
>>
>> Yahoo! Groups Links
>>
>>
>>
>>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
